grammar:
1. <sentence> ::= <word> | <word> <sentence>
2. <word> ::= "lug" | "dax" | "bluf" | "zup" | "wif"

    Rules:
    1. "lug" corresponds to "blue"
    2. "dax" corresponds to "green"
    3. "bluf" corresponds to "blue"
    4. "zup" corresponds to "yellow"
    5. "wif" corresponds to "red"

    The order of the words in the input corresponds to the order of the colors in the output.

<phrase> ::= <word> | <word> <phrase>
<word> ::= "lug" | "bluf" | "zup" | "wif" | "dax"

    Mapping:
    "lug" -> "blue"
    "bluf" -> "blue"
    "zup" -> "yellow"
    "wif" -> "red"
    "dax" -> "green"

    Abstract Rules:
    1. The input and output phrases have the same number of words.
    2. Each word in the input phrase maps to a specific word in the output phrase.
    3. The order of words in the input phrase corresponds to the order of words in the output phrase.
